body_html:
1. DLL Error:
    ImportError: Could not find 'msvcp140.dll'. TensorFlow requires that this DLL be
    installed in a directory that is named in your %PATH% environment variable. You
    may install this DLL by downloading Visual C++ 2015 Redistributable Update 3 fr
    om this URL: https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=53587

  2. NUMPY Error:

(train_data, train_labels), (test_data, test_labels) = imdb.load_data(num_words=10000)
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "", line 1, in
File "...\lib\site-packages\tensorflow\python\keras_impl\keras\datasets\imdb.py", line 77, in load_data
indices = np.arrange(len(x_train))
AttributeError: module 'numpy' has no attribute 'arrange'

  1. KERAS Error:
    original posted sample code
    import tensorflow as tf
    from tensorflow import eras

OR

Recommended fix
Get Keras error

from tensorflow.python import keras
from keras.datasets import imdb
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "", line 1, in
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'keras'

body:
1) DLL Error:
ImportError: Could not find 'msvcp140.dll'. TensorFlow requires that this DLL be
 installed in a directory that is named in your %PATH% environment variable. You
 may install this DLL by downloading Visual C++ 2015 Redistributable Update 3 fr
om this URL: https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=53587

2) NUMPY Error:
>>> (train_data, train_labels), (test_data, test_labels) = imdb.load_data(num_words=10000)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "...\lib\site-packages\tensorflow\python\keras\_impl\keras\datasets\imdb.py", line 77, in load_data
    indices = np.arrange(len(x_train))
AttributeError: module 'numpy' has no attribute 'arrange'

3) KERAS Error:
original posted sample code  
import tensorflow as tf
from tensorflow import eras

OR

Recommended fix
Get Keras error
>>> from tensorflow.python import keras
>>> from keras.datasets import imdb
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'keras'
